com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator
Class ConstraintService

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.ConstraintService

public class ConstraintService
extends java.lang.Object

Constraint Service that manages the objects defined in the 'constraints' extension point. Provided methods to validate a constraint and other constraint-related methods. Implementation assumes that ConstraintManager loads all constraint extension declarations at start-up.

Method Detail

validate

public IStatus validate(Constraint constraint,
                        DeployModelObject context,
                        IProgressMonitor monitor)
Validates the constraint. 1. Compute the set of validators for which all 4 conditions hold: (a) the validator is registered for this constraint (Java) type; (b) validator.canValidateConstraint(constraint) == true; (c) parent DMO is valid; (d) context is valid. 2. If the set of applicable validators is emty -> report an error; else validate the constraint with all validators in the set, report all produced statuses.

Parameters:
constraint - constraint to validate.
context - the context in which the constraint should be validated.
monitor - progress monitor
Returns:
the validation status, instance of MultiStatus if maltiple statuses.

validateForPotentialMatch

public IStatus validateForPotentialMatch(Constraint constraint,
                                         DeployModelObject context)
This method is an alternative version of validation that is used when the constraint participates in some external matching process (e.g., hosting link matching). For example, Requirement Expression is validated differently during the proper validation process and during the validation that participates in the hosting/dependency link matching. Implementation is identical to the validate() method, except that it invokes ConstraintValidator.validateForPotentialMatch(com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.Constraint, com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.DeployModelObject) on validators.

Parameters:
constraint - constraint to validate.
context - the context in which the constraint should be validated.
Returns:
validation status.

applicableConstraints

public java.util.List<ShortConstraintDescriptor> applicableConstraints(DeployModelObject parentDmo)
Produces the list of applicable (legal) child constraints for the given DMO.

Parameters:
parentDmo - the parent constraint
Returns:
list of applicable (legal) child constraints. May be an empty list, but never NULL.

applicableConstraints

public java.util.List<ShortConstraintDescriptor> applicableConstraints(DeployModelObject parent1,
                                                                       DeployModelObject parent2)
Produces the list of applicable (legal) child constraints that can be put on a constraint link connecting two given DMOs.

Parameters:
parent1 -
parent2 -
Returns:
list of applicable (legal) child constraints. May be an empty list, but never NULL.

getContextForChildConstraints

public DeployModelObject getContextForChildConstraints(Constraint constraint)
Returns the validation context DMO that the constraint will use to evaluate its child constraints. Returns NULL, if no such context can be determined (e.g., if there are no validators associated with the constraint), or if no child constraints are allowed on the given constraint. Implementation gets the first Constraint Validator that can validate the constraint and invokes ConstraintValidator.getContextForChildConstraints(Constraint) on it.

Parameters:
constraint - the constraint that that is being asked
Returns:
Returns the validation context DMO that the constraint will use to evaluate its child constraints. Returns NULL, if no such context can be determined, or if no child constraints are allowed on the given constraint.

title

public java.lang.String title(Constraint constraint)
Returns the title of the specified constraint. Does not contextualize the constraint description with the title of its child constraints. Implementation gets the first Constraint Validator that can validate the constraint and invokes ConstraintValidator.title(Constraint) on it.

Parameters:
constraint - the constraint whose title should be returned.
Returns:
the constraint title.
See Also:
titleWithContext(Constraint)

titleWithContext

public java.lang.String titleWithContext(Constraint constraint)
Returns the title of the specified constraint in the context of its constraint children. Example: "hostname = 'foo'" + " " + " or " + "hostname = 'bar'" Implementation gets the first Constraint Validator that can validate the constraint and invokes ConstraintValidator.title(Constraint) on it.

Parameters:
constraint - the constraint whose contextual title should be returned.
Returns:
the constraint title in the context of its children.
See Also:
title(Constraint)

getAllConstraintLinkMatchers

public java.util.List<LinkMatcher> getAllConstraintLinkMatchers()
Returns the list of instances of Link Matchers defined in the element of the 'constraints' extension point. If no matchers registered, returns empty list.

Returns:
list of LinkMatchers
